elements.title: Jacquetta Hawkes (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that archaeologist and prehistorian Jacquetta Hawkes (pictured) co-founded the Homosexual Law Reform Society and the Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament?

elements.title: WNJC-FM (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that for more than a decade, WNJC-FM at Northwest Mississippi Junior College was the state's only public radio station?

elements.title: Golden Years (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when David Bowie performed "Golden Years" on Soul Train in 1975, he was incoherent and visibly intoxicated?

elements.title: Oceans (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that gameplay in the board game Oceans ends once the ocean zones are depopulated of fish?

elements.title: Awet Tesfaiesus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Awet Tesfaiesus was the first black woman ever elected to the Bundestag?

elements.title: Berknet (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Eric Schmidt developed Berknet, an early wide area network system, in 1978 while he was a student at Berkeley University?

elements.title: Zeliha Ağrıs (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Zeliha Ağrıs started performing taekwondo at age ten and became a world champion when she was 19?

elements.title: .kosher (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that OK Kosher got the OK for .kosher in January 2014?
